item.title: Vp debate
item.dc:creator: @army_life army_life
item.description:
@army_life wrote:

[quote=“magma, post:1, topic:235522”][quote]
Today, 54 percent of America is considered overweight; 20 percent is clinically obese (BMI over 30). According to the dean of American obesity studies, University of Colorado, James 0. Hill, “If obesity is left unchecked, almost all of America will be overweight within a few generations” In fact, already 25 percent of Americans under age 19 are overweight or obese. In 1998, U.S. Surgeon General Dr. David Satcher declared childhood obesity an epidemic. And according to William Dietz, director of nutrition, Centers for Disease Control, the public cost of this epidemic will be hundreds of billions of dollars by 2020, making the economics of AIDS look like chicken feed.
[/quote]
… and that’s from you’re own country.

The UK is the fattest Country in Europe btw so don’t talk to much.

I wouldn’t be in any position to argue against that, although I do have a feeling you just made it up. Anyway, what’s being the “fattest country” in Europe against being the fattest country in the world?[/quote]

No we are not the fattest country in the world you ‘ignorant twat’ we are actually number 9.

Making it up…

Telegraph.co.uk

Britain becomes the fat man of Europe

Britain is the fattest country in Europe, the Government said yesterday as it published the most comprehensive picture yet of the nation's health.

Mail Online

Overweight Britons are among the fattest in Europe

Britons are fatter than their Italian, Spanish and French neighbours and are among the heaviest people in Europe, according to figures from the European Commission

http://news.bbc.co.uk/cbbcnews/hi/newsid_6030000/newsid_6036100/6036187.stm

http://www.mywire.com/a/AFP//1891187?&pbl=273

Need more proof?

item.title: Vp debate
item.dc:creator: @army_life army_life
item.description:
@army_life wrote:

R.I.P RSC:

fat people (that would be 80% of America)

I’m tired of you guys just pulling random percentages out of your ass… Seriously do some research

(2004) 17% of children were obese (Age 1-19)
(2004) is 32.2% of adults suffer from obesity (that’s almost 90 million a step down from being place over weight).

The main reason is there is so many people in America and America is wealthy (Its people) everything is made in convenience so over years we just got lazy.

Now I will agree this country has very low ‘Physical expectations’ its not like how some people show it you walk down the street and everyone is fat thats not how it is The Anti-american video’s never show the good just the bad, The UK is the fattest Country in Europe btw so don’t talk to much.

And while I'm busy typing anyways: the war on terror can be easily won. Just use the same tactics as the terrorists do. Unexpected attacks, but mainly dirty attacks. Bomb a suburb, shoot some captured terrorists, bomb the hell out of the mountains they hide in. They are like ants, use the right repelent and you can get rid of them.

In a way thats what British/American forces are doing (Ever heard of navy seals.) Shoot captured prisoners can’t that would defy the Geneva convention. But its not that simple you cannot kill innocent people that are pro-forces. Then you have people like China and Iran who step in because of this causing the OFFICIAL 3rd world war possibly nuclear.
